result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2022 at 08:00 am.

8:02 AM Defendant Laura Lee Schulfer not in court.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer appeared by video for Laura Lee Schulfer.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF55 and 21CF148.  Def is ill is on Attorneys phone.  No paper work filed in cases.  Atty comments on paperwork.  State is willing to give def a short period to resolve with DEJ coming up with the money.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 08:00 am.

10:29 AM Defendant Laura Lee Schulfer in court.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer in court for Laura Lee Schulfer.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF148 and 22CF55.  Atty - off record def to waive right to prelim hearing.  Atty and def agree.  Def waives right to prelim hearing in both cases, def understands rights giving up.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court reviewing criminal complaints in both cases.  Court finds PC in both cases that a felonies were committed in Ashland County cases are bound over for arraignment.  State is filing information now, both information's contain same charges as complaints.  Atty states there is a resolution in case.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:08 AM Defendant Laura Lee Schulfer in court.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer appeared by video for Laura Lee Schulfer.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF148 and 22CF55.  21CF148 prelim hearing not completed.  22CF55 here for initial appearance.  22CF55, Atty def has recv'd copy of complaint, waives reading, stands mute, waives time limits for prelim hearing.  Def agrees waiving time limits.  Court accepts waiver.  If def appearances by zoom has to be by video if not with stipulation.  Atty filed motion.  Court denies motion.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Laura Lee Schulfer in court.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF148 and 22CF55.  Def applied for PD, qualifies.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:33 AM - 21 CF 148, 22 CF 55 - Defendant Laura Lee Schulfer in court.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Thought Atty Brewer was rep'ing her & is not.  Adv to reapply to SPD.  Ct adj's cases for def to apply for atty at SPD.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Covers cases 22 CF 55 & 21 CF 148
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
ACJ payment receipt, Bail Bond Info Sheet from ACJ, Notice RE Posting Bond form and a copy of signed cash bond

1:50 PM - 22 CF 55 & 21 CF 148 - Defendant Laura Lee Schulfer appeared by video (fr ACJ).  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty Heidi Brewer appears via video special today.  21 CF 148 warrant.  Just returned here from Milwaukee.  412 St Claire St, Ashland is phy & emplyr as IRIS program.  Mthr resides in Ashland.  Mail address - 54842  Reykdal Rd, Ashland.  St req Cash $1000 & absol.  Ct orders - $800/csh & absol covers bth cases.  Warrants cancelled.
